overview_of_class:
This course will introduce students to methods used in psychological research. Through readings, lectures, discussion, and hands-on activities (specifically the handling of a statistics program used for data collection and analyses), students will learn about the scientific approach to research designs and about the analysis and interpretation of data. They will participate in novel research projects and will write a report on each in the style used by research psychologists.

Primary goals are for students to learn (1) testing hypotheses, including data collection and statistical analyses, (2) writing effectively about research plans and findings, and (3) critically evaluating psychological research done by other people.
name: Research Methods in Psychology
title: WCAS PSYCH 205-0-20 Research Methods in Psychology
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Reg: Reserved for PSYCH, COG_SCI, NEUROSCI and MUS_THRY students only.

Through readings, lectures, discussion, and hands-on activities (specifically the handling of a statistics program used for data collection and analyses), students will learn about the scientific approach to research designs and about the analysis and interpretation of data. They will participate in novel research projects and will write a report on each in the style used by research psychologists.

Primary goals are for students to learn (1) testing hypotheses, including data collection and statistical analyses, (2) writing effectively about research plans and findings, and (3) critically evaluating psychological research done by other people.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture, Group work, Class participation, Research project, Writing assignments, Presentations, Discussion

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Paper- final, Group project, Presentations, Class participation, Group work, Exams, Homework, Writing assignments

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Research Methods: From theory to practice
Gorvine, Rosengren, Stein, & Biolsi
Oxford University Press
ISBN: 978-0-19-020182-1

class_attributes:
Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Prerequisites apply, see description

descriptions.value: Evaluation is based on completion of 3 APA style research reports, along with two essay exams and several short papers.

subject: PSYCH

overview_of_class: This course will introduce students to the scientific methods of psychology research, including research designs, measurement, reliability and validity, review and application of statistics, sampling techniques, and principles of experimental design, with an emphasis on critically evaluating the validity of research-based claims about behavior. Students will conduct original psychological research studies and report their findings.
name: Research Methods in Psychology
title: WCAS PSYCH 205-0-22 Research Methods in Psychology
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Reg: Reserved for PSYCH, COG_SCI, NEUROSCI and MUS_THRY students only.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will introduce students to the scientific methods of psychology research, including research designs, measurement, reliability and validity, review and application of statistics, sampling techniques, and principles of experimental design, with an emphasis on critically evaluating the validity of research-based claims about behavior. Students will conduct original psychological research studies and report their findings.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
By the end of the course, you will be able to:
1. explain the scientific approach and distinguish among different types of research designs.
2. complete research ethics training to become certified for conducting research.
3. measure variables using multiple techniques and discuss issues related to measurement.
4. summarize, analyze, and visualize data using statistics and graphing techniques.
5. describe various sampling techniques and discuss issues related to generalization.
6. distinguish among various types of experimental designs and choose the design most appropriate for a given situation.
7. draw sound conclusions based on the design and results of a scientific research study.
8. formulate a scientific hypothesis, design and conduct a research study to test that hypothesis, and report the findings.
9. critically evaluate research-based claims, as reported in diverse sources such as the popular press, advertisements, online media, and academic journals.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
Class participation: Participation in activities during lecture
Discussion: Participation in discussion during lecture
Group work: Group work on research projects
Lecture: Two 80-minute lectures weekly
Readings: Textbook readings and occasional online readings
Research project: Correlational and experimental research projects
Writing assignments: APA-style empirical reports

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Morling, B. (2014). Research methods in psychology: Evaluating a world of information (2nd ed.). New York, NY: W. W. Norton & Company. ISBN: 978-0-393-93693-3 (paperback), 978-0-393-90610-3 (looseleaf).

class_attributes:
Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Prerequisites apply, see description
subject: PSYCH
